channel.title: AI & Telecom News Digest
channel.description: Daily AI & Telecom insights curated by n8n + Perplexity

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Telecom companies must adopt generative AI to reduce costs, drive growth, improve security, and transform into tech-focused automators offering AI-driven services.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: GenAI adoption in telecoms accelerates, reaching nearly 300 implementations by November 2024, reports STL Partners.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Microsoft's upcoming Telco industry data model in Microsoft Fabric, launching April 2025, aims to accelerate telecom innovation and growth through Cloud and AI adoption.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: AWS has chosen 40 startups for its 2025 Generative AI Accelerator, providing up to $1 million in AWS credits and expert support.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The telecom industry is rapidly adopting generative AI, with half of surveyed companies having implemented initial AI solutions by 2025.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article highlights 150 AI use cases from startups, featuring Cursor, an AI-powered code editor with advanced generative AI and autonomous agent capabilities.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Deloitte's 2025 telecom outlook highlights generative AI as a key growth driver, with telcos exploring opportunities to capitalize on its expanding impact.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Generative AI, combined with AI-native platforms, zero trust, and quantum encryption, is driving the next growth wave in telecom enterprise security.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: EY warns the telecom sector faces increasing risks from AI challenges, ineffective transformations, and a complex geopolitical landscape.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A new report reveals 83% of telecom leaders fear falling behind and urges telcos to adopt Gen AI to achieve productivity gains desired by 63%.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The Richmond Fed questions whether current AI investments are replicating the 1990s telecom boom and bust, suggesting a potential AI bubble.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Singtel Enterprise plans to become an AI-first telco by advancing AI-driven network slicing, digital twins, and autonomous networks.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: NVIDIA's 2025 survey shows 84% of telecom companies leveraging AI to drive industry growth and innovation.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Malaysia launches Ryt Bank, its first AI-powered bank, while Google expands access to its Veo 3 AI video creation tools.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Agentic AI is poised to transform telecommunications by automating processes and significantly boosting operational efficiency across the industry.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: TelefÃ³nica highlights that major hyperscalers like AWS, Azure, and GCP are advancing public clouds by integrating generative AI, foundational models, and synthetic data technologies.
